name: Cribl Pack Information
description: Displays details about a selected pack.

search.query: ${cribl_packs} worker_group=$worker_group pack=$pack_name endpointName="cribl_packs_pipelines" | summarize by id

config.markdown:
# How to Use This Dashboard
---

Each panel of this dashbaord offers insights into the configuration of Cribl Stream. 

1. Pick the Worker Group and Pack you are interested in from the drop down above. 
2. For Cribl Pipelines: in order to see the contents of a particular pipeline, ensure that you select them in the filter. The detailed table will not populate unless a filter is selected.Note: It is recommended to review the pipeline contents within Cribl Stream once you have narrowed down which pipeline is applicable. The views there are much easier to interpret.

search.query: ${cribl_packs} worker_group=$worker_group pack=$pack_name endpointName="cribl_packs_inputs" | summarize by id, type, disabled, pipeline, port, status.health | project-away count_
${cribl_packs} worker_group=$worker_group pack=$pack_name endpointName="cribl_packs_outputs" | summarize by id, type, pipeline, port, status.health | project-away count_
${cribl_packs} worker_group=$worker_group pack=$pack_name endpointName="cribl_packs_routes" | summarize by name, disabled, filter, pipeline, output | project-away count_

${cribl_packs} endpointName="cribl_packs_pipelines" worker_group=$worker_group pack=$pack_name id=$pipeline_name  | extend functions=conf.functions
| mv-expand functions
| project id, functions.id, functions.description, functions.filter, functions.conf, functions.final
| render table
